documents.document: "Nobody can go back and start a new beginning, but anyone can start today and make a new ending.” Good advice, from Maria Robinson.
Regarding change,Jimmy Dean said this, "I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.”
Regarding opportunities, consider what Yogi Berra said, "When you come to a fork in the road, take it.”
Not all berries growing in the wild are edible.
Deal fairly, always.
Mind your own business.
Focus on the right solution for the customer.Not necessarily what they ask for initially,rather what they need to get the outcome they need.
If you want to be a leader, then cultivate other leaders & build their skills. Support others to succeed, rather than look for followers.
The future is unknown, by definition. However, one way to have more success at predicting, is to examine the past, then create the future.
“The capacity to learn is a gift; the ability to learn is a skill; the willingness to learn is a choice.” - Brian Herbert
Boyscout saying: "Leave your campsite in a better shape than when you found it". Good lesson for life & how to treat the world-with respect.
"Effective leadership is not about making speeches or being liked; leadership is defined by results not attributes" Peter Drucker
Knowledge is power. Knowledge is only power when you give it.
In business it's important to stay innovative. If a business doesn't disrupt itself, you can be sure its competitors will disrupt them.
Nobody likes to be wrong, even if he or she knows. Rather than criticize, reprimand, or admonish, find a different way, - less confronting.
You will never be uninterested if you view every life experience, regardless of what it is, as the opportunity to learn something useful.
Begin your passion.Overcome fear of failure.Doing builds momentum. In life the #1 reason people succeed is 'cos they have created momentum.
Don't let fear of failure hold you back from starting.Commit & take action, even for a few minutes.SOME action rather none gets you to Flow.
IQ only explains appx 20% of how you do in life;the other 80% is EQ,a learnable skill.Self-awareness & also knowing how others perceive you.
A Harvard Univ. study found that people who ate approx. half a cup of blueberries every week, had 10% lower BP than others. (anthocyanins)
Eating smart keep BP in check. Univ of Minnesota study (2013)found that people who ate regular breakfast are less likely to develop high BP.
Life is filled with stress, so we naturally seek out things, & people, that help us to de-stress. Humour helps to de-stress, smiling too.
You work best when you reduce / remove stress. Find ways to minimise tension between people, teams. Review deadlines, and prepare ahead.
No one can fight with you if you don't want to fight.
From a distance a field of grass may look like the lawn, yet on closer inspection you notice it's completely overgrown with weeds.
The elderly & the disabled, want respect & independence.Certainly they don't want help,if it diminishes their sense of self-worth & dignity.
When you smell something "off",even a faint whiff,there's usually reason to suspect foul play. Trust your intuitive instincts,they're sharp.
In Michael E Gerber's "The eMyth", for business owners, distinguishes between working ON your business rather than working IN your business.
Habits:Confront the root drivers of habitual behaviour;accept them as intractable, then channel those cravings into new productive patterns.
In "The Power of Habit", Charles Duhigg offers a compelling view that understanding how habits work, is key to changing any set behaviour.
What lasts long after we do something is the feeling,& the relationships.Try cultivate meaningful wholesome,healthy memories, & connections.
Your character is your special unique make-up, underpinned by your life values & guiding principles. Protect your character to avoid hurt.
Seek tranquility, peace and harmony with people & nature. If you seek tranquility, slow down and do less.
For a successful life,find balance.Think clearly;prioritise;focus on process & objective;learn;improve;DO; rest;enjoy;have fun & appreciate.
Seek calm.
Think BIG. Set colossal dreams.Follow your https://t.co/p4PE7aYssW a constant learner, committed to continuous improvement. All IS possible.
In business,like life,it doesn't matter what you do;it matters WHY you do it.Start with "Why".Find,know your purpose, to unlock inspiration.
Daniel H Pink, shatters paradigm on motivation in his book, Drive.3 keys:AUTONOMY, to self direct; MASTERY to improve & PURPOSE,beyond self.
To pitch effectively follow the STRONG method. Set the frame;Tell the story;Reveal the intrigue;Offer the prize;Nail the hook;Get decision.
It's a myth you have to earn a high income to be rich. There's a big difference between working for money & having your money work for you.
To achieve wealth,you don't have to be perfect.Nor the smartest person.It does require you to invest in fin. education, & to be disciplined.
It's not a dirty aspiration to want to be "rich". In fact, I urge you make that a goal. Not your only goal, or focus, but one to include.
Wondering if you can do something is not the same as doing https://t.co/i3oYZjXtEm can achieve what you believe.Do it,don't wonder or doubt.
Keep repeating to yourself, as often as you can, with deep conviction and focus, you can do anything you set your mind to accomplish.
Willpower is like a muscle; it needs to be exercised frequently to build resilience, stamina and strength.
If it walks like a duck, quacks like a duck, swims like a duck, but you think it's a snake, then it's a snake. Trust your gut instinct.
Winners have systems,not only goals.To be a winner requires application over time of a proven,or well-conceived method,in a clear direction.
Life improves when we acknowledge that we don't have to know everything and we don't have to pretend that we do.
Frequently check & re-calibrate your thinking & assumptions about your potential. Remove the limits we typically place on our abilities.
'Whole-life thinking' is what I suggest you aspire to achieve.In short,to find balance between body,mind, spirit,social,vocation, financial.
If you ask,'what's your purpose?' remember,you're here on earth to either meet a need,or solve a problem,but most importantly, to add value.
To lower blood pressure eat:bananas,avo's,cucumbers,celery,apples,garlic,lemon,honey,coconutwater,spinach,beet juice,omega 3 fish,magnesium.
A tree grew differently from all other forest trees.They laughed, & mocked him.The tree felt sad-until he started baring the finest fruit.
Make the time to visit, or speak with, or connect with your grandparents.Listen more than you speak, by asking them questions, to guide you.
Hug your children as often as they will let you. Train them early to be receptive to appropriate hugs. Hug your parents too.
Acknowledge those that deserve it. Be open & selfless in your acknowledgement. Above all, be sincere, if you compliment someone.
There's a farmer who lets his chickens run free in their large, interesting field of play. He feeds them natural feed. Best tasting chooks!
Make time to stop and just relax.
If you always act with integrity, you will never go wrong.
A sure sign of stupid thinking is wanting a different outcome, yet thinking the same, repeating the same behaviour as before.
There's action without planning the result. No sense in that approach. There's planning, without action; equally silly. Plan,then act is it!
The greatest,often-forgotten & precious resource is "Time". Whether linear as we experience-or not,use Time wisely:to do, to live, to rest.
To enjoy the shade, beauty, & fruits of your tree,you need to plant it in the right place, water as needed, & nourish as required. Patience.
If you don't have a clear goal, how can you expect to achieve? If you don't have plan, how can you execute your objective?Set a goal & plan.
If you ignore people, they will conclude you are not interested. Then, you'll be ignored as a result. So show your'e interested & listen.
The sea does not announce the rips that are treacherously coursing through near the beach, so when you enter, be alert, & avoid the riptide.
Just because you can, doesn't mean you should. Before you move ahead, first think through the reasons for doing, and the timing.
Oil the doors and gates that are bound to squeak before they do.
Those who learn the power of sincere & selfless contribution & adding value for others, experience life's deepest joy: true fulfillment.
It's important to remember that you don't always have to be right. You don't always have to say what you think.
"Give me 6 hours to chop down a tree and I'll spend the first 4 sharpening my axe." Abraham Lincoln
Find the goodness in others, look for the good qualities, rather than defaulting to what's not right; what you don't like, what's different.
Winners think that everything happens for a reason, that every adversity is an opportunity to learn, & the challenge offers greater benefit.
An effective way to become more than you are satisfied with, is to spend time with people that already exemplify what you want to become.
Challenge the status quo but if you do, always with respect for the views and approach of others.
Accept that failure is part of the journey of discovery and improvement.
In business try figure out what you can do to help others that nobody else can do better than you.
Ask for help & advice when you need it. No one knows it all. Trust others, ask for input, weigh the advice, & be agreeable to share control.
Find ways to cut through to the essence of an issue. To solve a problem, look for the most elegant, simple solution.
Trust your opinion and your instincts, yet still be open to listening and learning from others.
Do everything within your power to support your goals, as if there's no option but to achieve.
Expand your horizon of what's possible. Limitations to what's possible are self-imposed.
Don't tell people they are wrong. No one likes to be told they are wrong. If you must let someone know they are wrong, frame it sensitively.
"Success comes in CAN's, not cannot's"
Do what's right,not just what's easy.If it's right & easy, great.But always choose what's right, above what's easy.
If you're guiding someone,or a team,provide your advice calmly. Make corrections seem easy.Engage. Be consistent. Praise good performance.
Bending to accomodate someone else's view, should not be considered a weakness. Always bending, regardless of circumstance, should.
If you don't treat yourself with respect, how can you expect anyone else to do so?
You can count all you like, sometimes it's not about the numbers.
Everybody tends to overrate their own performance. Useful to know so you can self-correct.
Since the future has unknown variables, beyond our ability to predict, we can cherish this moment; learn from the past, & invent the future.
Having a burning ambition to succeed is the 1st step.The 2nd,even more important step on the road to success,is sustained hard work & focus.
To connect with someone, try to build a rapport.To build a rapport, try subtle mirroring of body language & style. It should not be obvious.
This simple image, (and captions), aptly illustrates the distinction between following the path of the customer, com…https://t.co/5EtR1m5Zsw
Here's a great example of creative thinking to solve a problem. Simple and effective. Agree? Do you have any other…https://t.co/Dp35IdoPRT
It's so much easier to travel a long distance with a crew of fine, interesting people.
You'd be crazy to repeat the same thing over and over & hope or expect different results. To achieve a different outcome, requires a change.
Invest time now in being your future ideal self. Practice being the change you envision by making small changes and improvements every day.
If something or someone is blocking your progress, first ask why before you try and proceed.
These tweets should hardly be considered advice.They're 140 chr. for heavens sake.So treat them merely as "thought starters", nothing more.
